intro: Gagea filiformis, commonly known as the slender gagea, is a small, bulbous plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its bulbs are underground and serve as storage organs, allowing the plant to survive periods of dormancy. Gagea filiformis is often found in association with other woodland flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
